items.awarder: School of Public Policy and Urban Affairs, Northeastern University
items.title: Graduate Student Leadership Award

items.summary:
* Studying the Effect of public transportation on Somerville’s urban growth using the ‘R’ statistical language
* Examining Somerville’s Transportation Infrastructure using various spatial analysis tools within ArcGIS
* Understanding the Social and Infrastructural Factors Relating to Spatial Inequality in Pune, India using the Python programming language
* Graphical Visualisation of the Pune City Tree Census 2015 using R, and Adobe Creative Suite
* **Relevant Courses**: Urban Theory & Science, Big Data for Cities, Advanced Spatial Analysis, Introduction to GIS, Information Design & Visual Analytics

* Analyzing the potential of civic institutions as catalysts for urban rejuvenation, MG Road, Gangtok, India
* Questioning Urban Paradigms - Studying the Changing Face of the Tulshibaug Temple Market District, Pune, India
* **Relevant Courses:** Urban Design & Planning, Architectural Design

items.title: Developing Transit Corridors for Hospital Workers

items.summary:
* Using ArcGIS and the R statistical language, developed a ‘Covid-19 Safety Index’ for sidewalks in the City of Boston, to develop insights on sidewalk carrying capacity across Boston neighborhoods.
* Profiling street morphologies for Indian cities using the OSMNx package in the Python programming
language

* Analyzed origin-destination data from the Transit App and vehicle position data from MBTA GTFS feeds, to predict route and mode preferences of commuters across the network.
* Identify existing and develop new transit corridors between essential workers; homes and work location for swift, isolated movement during pandemics. *developed in the wake of the current Covid-19 crisis*

* Assist analysts in the OPMI (Office of Performance Management and Innovation) by writing R-scripts to contribute transit data insights to the MassDOT Tracker performance report.
* Developing a SQL integrated R-script to compare transit trips with equivalent  single-occupancy car trips  measuring CO2 emissions, time taken, and miles traveled. Sourced data from transit planning and revenue department databases.
* Using R and Adobe Illustrator, created visualizations of insights on pedestrian and bicycle crash data sourced from the MassDOT IMPACT crash portal to present to the Massachusetts Bicycle and Pedestrian Advisory Board

items.position: Urban Design Trainee to Associate Urban Designer
items.summary:
* Led a team of 3 on research surveys for the redevelopment of a historic retail/wholesale market
* Redesigned streets in Bangalore to comply with the 'complete streets' design and execution model
* Part of team to redesign a multi-modal transit exchange terminal in central Bangalore.
* Surveyed 35 roads in central Bangalore (30 miles) to prepare base drawings for equitable road design
* Designed and supervised the construction of a plaza in central Bangalore. 
* Archived and simplified the office file storage and naming system.
* Conducted weekly team-building exercises with co-workers, as well as hosting talks by experts
